title: Dog Walks Extraordinaire
name: Dog Walks Extraordinaire
description:
A Map by Alyss05

A map of my favorite dog walks. Most of these are hikes, but dog parks are included as well.

properties.name: Ashland Dog Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  Ashland Dog ParkA lovely fenced dog park with shade trees, a shelter, picnic tables, pooper scoopers, a small dog area and a big tub for dogs to splash around in. At the bottom of the park is a gate and short trail to Bear Creek for more cooling off.

properties.name: Forest Park - NW Thurman St
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  Forest Park is the largest forested area within a city limits in the US and I am always looking for new ways to access it. This is a really popular entrance that leads onto the Leif Ericson drive. People with strollers, dogs and runners all use this road, but there are nice trails going off it.

properties.name: Gabriel Park - summer dog park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  My neighborhood park of choice. The park itself is huge and it has trails through open fields and forest area. The summer dog park is at the 45th entrance and is fenced, huge, grassy and busy. Look for the winter dog park during the wet months.

properties.name: Gabriel Park - winter dog park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  The winter dog park is in the part of the park called Little Gabriel. It is sanded to protect streams from doggy run off making for an interesting experience. On dry days everyone comes home with sand in their hair. It is smaller than the summer dog park so on nice weekends it can get a little crowded. Easy access to the walking trails in the park though, but watch the little leaguers in the spring.

properties.name: Marquam Nature Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  From the entrance on Sam Jackson Rd you can hike up a canyon, loop around another or follow the trails all the way up to Council Crest. Because the trails are down in the canyon you really feel like you are out in the woods, but its really just the West Hills! The trails connect all through here and you can hike for miles if you have the stamina. One of the connections is the 40 mile loop trail that circumnavigates Portland.

properties.name: Oredson Todd Woods Access
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05This parking spot connects you to the all weather trail in Oredson Todd woods and eventually to the White Rabbit and other trails in the Ashland Watershed.

properties.name: Powell Butte Nature Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 This park is very popular with hikers, dog walkers and in the dry months bikers and horseback riders. I love going here on clear days because from the top you can see the mountains loud and clear. Trails range from paved to rutted, from open meadow to deep Douglas fir woods. Check the map at the parking lot. Be sure to have a leash with you because the rangers do patrol.

properties.name: Terwilliger Trail Access
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 The trail goes off from the west side of Terwilliger Blvd and is pretty clearly marked with a green Marquam Trail/40 mile loop sign. This trail goes up through the woods to meet up with the Maquam Nature park trails at Marquam Hill Road. Parking is in the pull outs along Terwilliger.

properties.name: Tryon Creek State Park - Boones Ferry Rd entrance
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  This is a lesser known entrance to Tryon park that is most popular with dog walkers and runners. Coming from the north the entrance is on the left, right after the nursery. There is a map at the entrance and the trail connects to the West Horse loop, a nice easy hike.

properties.name: Tryon Creek State Park, Main Entrance
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05 A beautiful park with tons of trails. From the main parking lot I really enjoy taking the dogs on the North Horse Loop. There are generally fewer hikers here so it is easier to let the dogs loose. The nature center has maps of all the trails in the park, and there are many!

properties.name: Tumalo Mountain
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05This is very popular as a backcountry ski area in the winter, but in the summer and fall it is a lovely hike. The top affords spectacular views of 3 Sisters and Bachelor. My dog is named after this peak.

properties.name: Woods Memorial Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  One of the great little canyon parks in SW Portland. Access from Woods Parkway off 48th/45th and Taylors Ferry or neighborhood streets like Marigold and 43rd. A neighborhood group has been doing great restoration work here but it is still a little used hideaway.
